steps.title: Remove your pork chops from the refrigerator 30 minutes prior to cooking.
steps.content: Remove your pork chops from the refrigerator 30 minutes prior to cooking. You will ensure even cooking and a nice crust.

steps.title: Sprinkle freshly ground black pepper and salt on one side of the chops.
steps.content: Sprinkle freshly ground black pepper and salt on one side of the chops. Sprinkle enough so that it is well covered. Pork chops benefit from quite a bit of seasoning.

steps.title: Turn the pork chops over.
steps.content: Turn the pork chops over. Repeat on the second side.

steps.title: Heat a pan on high heat.
steps.content: Heat a pan on high heat. Then, add your oil and turn it down to medium heat.

steps.title: Place your pork chops in the pan with a pair of tongs.
steps.content: Place your pork chops in the pan with a pair of tongs. Let them sear on one side until there’s a golden crust. Then, turn them.

steps.title: Use a meat thermometer for the perfect doneness.
steps.content: Use a meat thermometer for the perfect doneness. When inserted into the center, it should read 135 °F (57.2 °C) (57 Celsius).

steps.title: Allow the chops to rest on a cutting board, covered in foil, for 10 minutes.
steps.content: Allow the chops to rest on a cutting board, covered in foil, for 10 minutes. They will continue to cook and reach the 145-degree (63 Celsius) recommended temperature while remaining moist.

steps.title: Remove the chops from the refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking.
steps.content: Remove the chops from the refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking.

steps.title: Sprinkle both sides of the chops with garlic salt.
steps.content: Sprinkle both sides of the chops with garlic salt.

steps.title: Mix the remainder of the spices and sugar in a bowl.
steps.content: Mix the remainder of the spices and sugar in a bowl. Remember that you can adjust your spices to include almost any spice you like. Look for Tuscan, barbecue, Spanish and Indian spice rubs, as they pair well with pork.

steps.title: Rub the spice mixture liberally on one side of the pork.
steps.content: Rub the spice mixture liberally on one side of the pork. Turn it over and rub the opposite side.

steps.title: Heat up your skillet to high heat.
steps.content: Heat up your skillet to high heat. Add your olive oil, and then turn it down to medium heat. Swirl the oil.

steps.title: Place your chops in the skillet.
steps.content: Place your chops in the skillet. Cook on one side for two minutes, or until golden brown.

steps.title: Turn the pork chops over with tongs and cook for about four more minutes.
steps.content: Turn the pork chops over with tongs and cook for about four more minutes. Use a meat thermometer to ensure the internal temperature reaches 135 °F (57.2 °C) (57 Celsius). Once it does, rest it for 10 minutes on the cutting board. The pork will continue to cook and reach the preferred internal temperature of 145 degrees (63 Celsius).
